intro: Trichomanes jungermannioides, commonly known as the rock fern, is a member of the family Huperjaniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds. It is a non-vascular plant, belonging to the class Marchantiopsida, and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rock crevices and forest floors. The plant has a thalloid structure with a central axis and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spores are produced in cup-like structures called sporangia, which are clustered on the underside of its leaves. Trichomanes jungermannioides plays a role in soil stabilization and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
